org.flowvisor.classifier

Class WorkerSwitch

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flowvisor.classifier.WorkerSwitch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FVSendMsg, ChangedListener, FlowMapChangedListener, FlowvisorChangedListener, SwitchChangedListener, FVEventHandler

    public class WorkerSwitch
extends java.lang.Object
implements FVEventHandler, FVSendMsg, FlowMapChangedListener, FlowvisorChangedListener, SwitchChangedListener
    Taken from WorkerSwitch class This class represents virtual switch beneath LIME proxy and OF controller cannot see
    Author:
    capveg, Murad Kaplan

      • insertFlowRuleTableAndSendModified

        public static void insertFlowRuleTableAndSendModified(WorkerSwitch vlanSendingSwitch,
                                      WorkerSwitch vlanReceiverSwitch,
                                      java.util.Collection<FVFlowMod> flowTable,
                                      java.util.Map<DPID,java.util.List<FVFlowMod>> vlanModsMap)
        Copying flowTable from duplicate switch when migration is about to happen. Modify flowmod with action output to empty port. This occurs in the CLONE switch object, not the original switch. Should create a flowmod in the clone of a the original switch that add a vlan tag and sends the packet out the ghost port. For now, the vlan tag is the port on the original switch on which to output the packet. A flowmod must also be written to the original switch to strip the vlan tag and output on the port equal to the vlan tag #. Also need to change flow mods in the original that output on the port with the vlan tag # to instead add a vlan tag and output on the ghost port. Can be used to create original cloned flows or flows that need to be made after each host is migrated In future, we will need to have a translation table to map incoming vlan tags to the original rule (e.g. each rule in the original switch will have a vlan tag associated and will then have a rule written in the original switch that strips the tag and performs the actions of the original rule)
        Parameters:
        vlanSendingSwitch - The clone switch to write the flow mods to
        vlanReceiverSwitch - The original switch associated with this object. Could also be accessed with getDuplicateSwitch() I believe.
        flowTable - TODO
        vlanModsMap - TODO
        receivingGhostPort - The ghost port number of the switch that will receive the vlan tagged packets
        sendingGhostPort - The ghost port number of the switch that will send the vlan tagged packets

      • hasVlanAction

        public static boolean hasVlanAction(FVFlowMod flowMod)

      • hasOutputPortWithoutVlan

        public static boolean hasOutputPortWithoutVlan(FVFlowMod flowMod,
                               java.lang.Short port)

      • createVlanSenderMod

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Short,FVFlowMod> createVlanSenderMod(FVFlowMod flowMod,
                                                               WorkerSwitch senderSwitch)
        Creates a modified flow to the clone switch by creating a vlan tag associated with the original flow if it is an OFAction, adding the tag to the packet, and outputting the packet out the clone's ghost port. does NOT write the flowmod to the clone switch.
        Parameters:
        clone - The clone switch instance
        flowmod - The original flowmod in from the original switch
        cloneGhostPort - The ghost port in the clone
        Returns:
        A map of the vlan tag number to the flowmod

      • handleFlowModRemove

        public void handleFlowModRemove(FVFlowRemoved fr,
                       OriginalSwitch oSwitch)
        Check to see any match in worker switch flow table's for FlowRemove received from this worker switch If FlowMod match found, send FlowRemove to controller through mapped original switch
        Parameters:
        fr - FlowRemoved received from worker switch
        oSwitch - Original Switch that this worker switch map to
